001package squidpony.squidgrid.gui;
002
003import java.awt.event.MouseEvent;
004import javax.swing.event.MouseInputListener;
005
006/**
007 * This mouse listener allows for easy interface with a grid based system. This
008 * class covers all aspects of mouse movement and clicking, but not mouse wheel
009 * events
010 *
011 * This class is meant to be used as a wrapper to your own mouse listener, it
012 * simply converts the coordinates from UI Component x,y to Grid based x,y
013 *
014 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
015 */
016public class SquidMouse implements MouseInputListener {
017
018    private final int cellWidth, cellHeight;
019    private final MouseInputListener listener;
020
021    /**
022     * Sets the size of the cell so that all mouse input can be evaluated as
023     * relative to the grid. All input is passed to the provided listener once
024     * it has had its coordinates translated to grid coordinates.
025     *
026     * @param cellWidth
027     * @param cellHeight
028     * @param listener
029     */
030    public SquidMouse(int cellWidth, int cellHeight, MouseInputListener listener) {
031        this.cellWidth = cellWidth;
032        this.cellHeight = cellHeight;
033        this.listener = listener;
034    }
035
036    private MouseEvent translateToGrid(MouseEvent e) {
037        int x = e.getX() / cellWidth;
038        int y = e.getY() / cellHeight;
039        return new MouseEvent(e.getComponent(), e.getID(), e.getWhen(), e.getModifiersEx(), x, y, e.getClickCount(), e.isPopupTrigger(), e.getButton());
040    }
041
042    @Override
043    public void mouseClicked(MouseEvent e) {
044        listener.mouseClicked(translateToGrid(e));
045    }
046
047    @Override
048    public void mousePressed(MouseEvent e) {
049        listener.mousePressed(translateToGrid(e));
050    }
051
052    @Override
053    public void mouseReleased(MouseEvent e) {
054        listener.mouseReleased(translateToGrid(e));
055    }
056
057    @Override
058    public void mouseEntered(MouseEvent e) {
059        listener.mouseEntered(translateToGrid(e));
060    }
061
062    @Override
063    public void mouseExited(MouseEvent e) {
064        listener.mouseExited(translateToGrid(e));
065    }
066
067    @Override
068    public void mouseDragged(MouseEvent e) {
069        listener.mouseDragged(translateToGrid(e));
070    }
071
072    @Override
073    public void mouseMoved(MouseEvent e) {
074        listener.mouseMoved(translateToGrid(e));
075    }
076}
